sen.j: 日野誕生院（ひのたんじょういん）は、浄土真宗本願寺派の仏教寺院。
sen.e: Hino Tanjo-in Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Hongan-ji branch of the Pure Land Sect.

sen.j: 誕生院（たんじょういん）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also known as Tanjo-in Temple.

sen.j: 本願寺の飛地境内建物であり、親鸞の誕生の地を記念して1931年に建立された。
sen.e: The building stands within a detached precinct of Hongan-ji Temple and was constructed in 1931 to commemorate the birthplace of Shinran.

sen.j: 親鸞は1051年（永承6年）法界寺を建立した日野資業（ひのすけなり）の五代後の子孫の日野有範（ひのありのり）を父として誕生する。
sen.e: Shinran was born as the son of Arinori Hino, the 5th generation descendant of Sukenari Hino who founded Hokai-ji Temple in 1051.

sen.cmt: 指示書に合わせました。

sen.j: 当時、有範は皇太后の大進（だいしん）という役職にあったとされる。
sen.e: At that time, Arinori is believed to have served as Daishin (Senior Office Secretary) to the Empress Dowager.

sen.j: 母親は、清和源氏の八幡太郎義家の孫娘の吉光女であったと伝えられている。
sen.e: It is said that his mother was Kikkonyo, the granddaughter of Yoshiie HACHIMAN TARO of the Seiwa lineage of the Minamoto clan.

It is said that his mother was Kikkonyo, the granddaughter of Taro Yoshiie HACHIMAN of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: ここには産湯の井戸や胞衣塚（えなづか）が残っている。
sen.e: An ubuyu no ido (well from which water for a newborn infant's first bath was drawn) and Enazuka mound remain on the site.

sen.j: また、親鸞6歳の姿を写した銅像、得度式（とくどしき）に詠んだという和歌の、明日ありと思う心のあだ桜 夜半に嵐の吹かぬものかは、の石碑が建てられている。
sen.e: There is also a bronze statue depicting Shinran aged 6 years and stone monument with a poem supposedly composed by him during his Tokudo-shiki (ordination rite) reading

There is also a bronze statue depicting Shinran aged 6 years and stone monument with a poem standing within the precinct, supposedly composed by him during his Tokudo-shiki (ordination rite) reading; Asu ari to omo kokoro no adazakura, Yahan ni arashi no fukanu mono ka ha (the love and friendship that you believe will come tomorrow can be blown away like cherry blossom in an evening gale).

sen.j: 本堂は、格調高い雰囲気の回廊をめぐらし、中庭は銅灯ろう一基を中心に配し白州で構成されており、平安時代の貴族の館のような造りとなっている。
sen.e: The main hall has been constructed in a style similar to that of a Heian period noble family dwelling surrounded by an atmospheric corridor and featuring a courtyard garden consisting of white sand centered around a bronze lantern.

sen.e: Take the Keihan Bus for "Hino Tanjo-in" from Rokujizo Station on the Keihan Uji Line to the terminal stop.
